titleStmt.title: At my leaving Cambridge August the 14th, Extempore.
titleStmt.author: Sarah Fyge Egerton

bibl.title: At my leaving Cambridge August the 14th, Extempore.
bibl.author: Sarah Fyge Egerton

front.head: At my leaving Cambridge August the 14th, Extempore.

lg.l: adieu! I ne'er shall see thee more,
Nor feast my Soul at Learning's mighty Store;
Not one fresh Drop of thy ambrosial Sense,
To quench my Thirst at learned Expence;
Who's only is the streams of Wit;
I thy fair Colleges no more shall see,
The antient infant Learning which they taught,
Could only here be to Perfection brought;
They've finish'd all, each long hid Spring discern,
The Gods themselves may hover here and learn;
And if in every Grace they would advance,
Let give Wit, and teach Complaisance;
To th' sacred no more I come,
